page.title: 01Lowland West of Cambridge
page.content: This lowland area, the beginning of the Fens, and traversed by the Bourn Brook, lies at the foot of chalk hills which add character to the area and often act as a climatic divide. It is rural, with arable farming and a considerable modern residential development, much of it closely connected with the University or with industry, commerce or services in Cambridge City. A unique and outstanding feature is the Mullard Radio Telescope, the greater part of its lines of dishes & antenae lying within this block. A few orchards remain; a modern vineyard has been established. A small wood is used for storage of pyrotechnic materials. Although the Telescope had a restrictive influence on some industry, for reasons of possible
